meanings.definition: To cause a machine or device to operate.
meanings.sent1: Pressing the button will actuate the machine.
meanings.sent2: The key will actuate the engine of the car.
meanings.sent3: I told the remote to actuate the TV, but it refused!
meanings.sent4: His words actuated a chain reaction of events.
meanings.sent5: The wind actuated the windmill to spin rapidly.

meanings.definition: To motivate or incite someone to take action.
meanings.sent1: Her inspiring speech actuated the team to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The reward will actuate him to complete the task.
meanings.sent3: The promise of ice cream actuated the children to finish their homework.
meanings.sent4: The urgent message actuated him to call for help.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk actuated a winning mentality in the players.
